examples: For seven years, Pete, AKA Mr. Money Mustache, has been preaching parsimony on his popular blog.
To actually build our clades, the simplest approach is to go for maximum parsimony, where the phylogeny with the fewest number of gains or losses of a trait wins.
One tree was designed around the notion of parsimony, the idea that the simplest path for one species to diverge into another is the one with the fewest changes in features.
So, as zoologists using maximum parsimony, we’d choose the phylogeny that shows feathers evolving once.
words.defineEn: extreme care in spending money; reluctance to spend money unnecessarily
words.defineVi: cực kỳ cẩn thận trong việc tiêu tiền; miễn cưỡng tiêu tiền một cách không cần thiết

examples: It’s less parsimonious to assume that the ancestors of ostriches, chickens, and songbirds all evolved feathers independently.

words.defineEn: spending money very reluctantly

examples: [Narrator] The ferocity of the chili pepper is measured in Scoville heat units. -

examples: He is a ferocious fighter.

examples: And boy am I parched, Raindrop. - Oh, don't worry, Ryder!

examples: '80s teenagers even looked at the mall as a place to which they could escape and socialize, as was epitomized in the cult-classic movie "Mallrats."
